question: It was not due to milk but by My Order. Tableghi people say that the pious man did a shirk that is why Allah caught him
answer:
QUESTION
Some tableghi jamat people say in their beyans (speeches) that there was a pious man who was so Abid. Once he drank milk and after some time he felt pain in his belly. He said that I am feeling pain in my belly and it is due to the milk drunk by me. When that person was died, Allah SWT caught him and said to him why did you say that I am feeling pain in my belly due to the milk. It was not due to milk but by my order. Certainly all the happenings are by the order of Allah SWT. Those tableghi people say that the pious man did a shirk that is why Allah SWT caught him. I want to ask two questions about this. (1) Is this story or occurrence (happening) is true i.e. have you ever passed over this in any book. (2) If yes, is it really shirk i.e. can you not say about any creature it is due to this but in your heart you believe in that every happening is by the order of Allah SWT and this creature is only a means or source.
ANSWER


Share:
1. Yes, we have also come across this story.
2. For ordinary people like us, such incidents are not deemed Shirk. Since
the pious man had a very high level of Tawakkul and proximity to Allah, he
was taken to task even for thinking in this manner. There are external
causes for everything. For instance, fire burns but in reality it is Allah
who makes it happen. In the incident in question, the pious person was taken
to task merely because he shifted his focus from Allah to the milk. It did
not behove his level of Tawakkul to think in this manner even if the milk
was the external cause of his pain. In short, one may believe that
everything has an external cause but in reality it is Allah Ta'ala who makes
things happen.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Muhammad Kadwa
FATWA DEPT.
